name: Rao's
address: 455 E 114th St, New York, NY 10029, USA

reviews.text:
If you stand by your hard earned name, you are expected to
be "meticulously anal" about who and how is using it.
(Isn't this a great opening or what?)

2 simplistic scenarios:
1. you walk into the RAO, good food, reasonable service.
Weeks later you find RAO's frozen pizza in your neighborhood
supermarket. Recalling your near perfect RAO's experience you
cook it, using instructions and you are getting ... (image attached).
2. you are in your local supermarket scavenging for the late supper deal and accidentally stumble upon RAO's frozen pizza.
You cook it, per instructions and you get ... (image attached).
Some time later, roaming NY's Upper East, you stumple upon
RAO Pizza place.
Q at hand: would you consider using their servvices?

Net result: 1 customer lost.
Wonder if RAO ever conducts lessons learned ...

Hope this helps.

Unforgettable night at Raoâ€™s - from the food to the service and an unbeatable atmosphere this ranks as one of the best in NYC. Fried mutz, meatballs and the veal parm stole the show out of everything we ordered.
When describing Raoâ€™s you donâ€™t need any descriptions. Cause it is Raoâ€™s. ğŸ¤—

Frankie and Jimmy the Fish didnâ€™t pay me proper respect when I walked through the door. My mink coat wasnâ€™t checked in a timely fashion. Bobby the Grouch was hardly grouchy. Iâ€™m a made guy and demand tribute. The meatballs were fantastic tho. Absolutely delicious. One star.
Truly amazing. Worth the hype.
Private table but you can have a drink at the bar. Classic Italian place but most not able to enter for dinner

Iâ€™ll eat extra due to Kash P in this place
Fire food
Disregard the horrible reviews
Was there and saw Kash P there. Quickly lost my appetite and will not be going that way again. Hope they are able to clean up the riff raff
I will never visit this restaurant and I think yall know why.  Boycott.  Shame shame

For An Exclusive Restaurant It Is Anything But That. Food Is Very Mid, My Mom Makes Better Italian Food. Got Reservation Through My Good Friend T. Chalamet Who Has Been A Couple Times. Won't Be Back. Way To Cramped Inside.
I never tried, but apparently it's impossible to get a reservation. A restaurant that makes it difficult for you to eat there should always get a low rating.

It's always great. I'm rarely in NYC, but I love coming here. Attentive service. Trust their recommendations!

The prices are reasonable, quality, portions, and we are in NYC after all :-)

Big fan of the baked clams, garlic bread,  eggplant, fusilli, broccoli rabe...
The sauces are amazing.

Be sure to leave room in your stomach for the cheesecake.
Kash Patel eats there.
Iâ€™m here to eat, not to be gaslit
Some of the best Italian food,  I ever had.

The quintessential New York American Italian experience. Non fussy food cooked to perfection.

I am really, fully satisfied with a large meal of less heavy, healthier, and possibly lower gluten Italian durum wheat spaghetti topped with quality marinara sauce. I am even a picky snob as marinara should be ideally on its own a well seasoned and satisfying tomato sauce. The basic marinara sauce they make is superb. I love it and a dried parsley dash makes the dish. I wish to visit the restaurant. I love the pizza sauce on homemade honey whole wheat dough.
ğŸ¥¢ğŸ… ğŸ•

Dropped by Raoâ€™s on a whim â€” you know, as one does. Despite the fact itâ€™s famously impossible to get a table unless your great-grandfather once fixed jukeboxes with Frank Sinatra, the owners instantly relocated a table of six retired wiseguys in smoked sunglasses to make room for me. Had the veal, the meatballs, a little wine. Service was celestial, owners charming. Honestly, shocking they donâ€™t just hand out keys to strangers at the door.
Great food
I see some, One Star ratings it's obvious  they have never had the opportunity to eat at RAO'S NYC food was amazing as well as the service.
The best!
Absolutely amazing food. What a scene. Waiter Tom was amazing

Oh! My! Gosh!! Hello! I'm Deborah. I found some of your frozen meals, pizza and sauces at Walmart here in Arab Alabama ğŸ‘ I've never heard of you until I looked you up to see if you have restaurants, and of course your product sold at Walmart that prompted me to look you up. Your pizza sauce is totally amazing! I must have at least 50 jars. I bought all of them in the store the other day ğŸ˜ The sauce is so delicious that it prompted me to try out your frozen meals. Your four cheese ravioli your lasagna and your chicken parmesan is outstanding!!! I haven't tried your pizza yet, but I'm about to try the cheese one next time I go to the store and I'm just going to add some extra toppings to it. If your food taste this good just from the grocery store, I can imagine how amazingly delicious it will taste in your restaurants!!â¤ï¸ğŸ•Šï¸ I wish I could try your restaurant, but unfortunately there's none of your restaurants around my area. I will be moving back to California soon Woodland California which is around the Sacramento area. It would be nice if you can get a restaurant there! If you did I would bring my sleeping bag and camp outside Lol ğŸ¤£ Oh my gosh I just can't believe how good your food is. I'm telling everybody about it!! Walmart can't keep up with me. I keep buying all your pizza sauce! Walmart also sells your pasta sauce as well. I haven't tried those. I bought the caramelized onion one and the marinara one and I haven't tried those yet, but I'm sure they're going to be totally delicious. Thank you so much for your delicious food. There's not much restaurants here in this little town that I live in so I really appreciate your food!! ğŸ• ğŸ ğŸ«™ Happy Father's Day to all the dad's out there and y'all have a blessed rest of the weekend and the next following week ğŸ™ğŸ˜‡ğŸ™ I give you 10 Stars for your wonderful food!!! â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â­â­ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†â¤ï¸ğŸ•Šï¸ğŸŒ¹ğŸŒ¹ğŸŒ¹ I almost forgot your tomato basil soup sold in jars and your Italian wedding soup both very delicious ğŸ˜‹ You have Many! Dishes in the frozen section of the grocery store. So many that I can't keep up with adding them to this review ğŸ˜‹ I had to go to Guntersville Alabama to the Publix market there where they sell even More! Dishes. I bought your meatballs in sauce. Haven't tried them yet, but I already know they are Delish!!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ I also bought your variety meat pizza, your vegetarian lasagna and other pasta dishes with white sauceğŸ˜‹ I would love to try and buy on a regular basis your eggplant Parmesan but none of the stores have it. I heard that Target sells it. I may have to go there as well. I'm going to have to buy a second freezer to fit all your delishes dishes because my freezer is packed with Rao's s only! Store bought frozen meals I will ever buy. ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ Thank you for making it possible for the world to have the chance to have your food in Thier freezers and cupboards. I also bought four more of your soups. Different ones as well â¤ï¸â€ğŸ©¹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†ğŸ†â­â­â­â­â­ God Bless you and your family ğŸ™ğŸ˜‡ğŸ™
So much history and mystique
Best atmosphere when I go ......enjoy it every time.

Place genuinely Needs a revamp asap, make it make sense it's 2025 you're telling me you need to know someone to eat here or get take out ? Come on really But yet any random person can order from the bar So it's not really an exclusive dining experience. Location is in harlem but somehow all the latest  customers are out of towners from Wisconsin? Yeah I'm good.
Exceptionally good excellent Italian food service is phenomenal. Next time youâ€™re in New York. You must stop by.
Es ist jedesmal hervorragend.
They'll never let me in there by a long shot.
Best place !!! Best meatballs
I've been to better Italian restaurants. It's pretty good but I don't know what the big deal is other than some famous people there and some hoodlums.
Great
Amazing food
Once in a lifetime NY experience
Wow, amazing experience,  authentic as it gets, awesome staff, amazing food. Unbelievable meatballs!

I own a concierge and event planning agency, so I quite literally go to all types of incredible restaurants for a living. None can be compared to Raoâ€™s. Itâ€™s not only â€œworth the hypeâ€, but from the second you walk up to the restaurant, you feel the history. The food is obviously unreal, but itâ€™s the experience that will really change you. The Maitre D, Joe, sits down with you and explains the menu to you. Itâ€™s so old school and heâ€™s great at helping you order exactly enough food. I still dream about how great the food was, and to say I canâ€™t wait to go back is an extreme understatement. It was truly a bucket list item for me to go there, and if anyone gets the opportunity to go, take itâ€”you will not be disappointed!

The ONLY thing is, itâ€™s â€œcash onlyâ€ so plan accordingly!
Itâ€™s worth the wait trust me, you know who has been there, give a chance

Raoâ€™s is a true standout, offering flawless service, a warm ambiance, and exceptional cuisine. From crisp salads to golden fried cheese and fresh seafood, every dish reflects quality and authenticity. Guests rave about their experience, making it one of our top dining recommendations. Weâ€™re proud to partner with Raoâ€™s and excited to keep sending clients their way!
Amazing food, even better atmosphere. When you eat here, you feel like family. Blessed to have had the experience to dine here

The best, there is nothing that brings you back to a memory of better days then Rao's NYC,    it is a combo of atmosphere and culinary genius that is absolutely impossible to replicate. While the incredible dishes look as if they have been pulled from a five-star Michelin restaurant. The authenticity of the food takes you back to Nana's kitchen in the old country and if that doesn't make you feel nostalgic enough just wait until Tommy  comes to your table to plan your meal like it was the president's daughter's wedding while making you feel like family. Even if just for the night you'll have that reminiscent  feeling of being in back in the neighborhood when there still was neighborhoods, thanks guys You're the best

My favorite  restaurant  in NY.
Safest  street to park car on in Harlem.
I was only able to order take out because I was with a famous regular. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. Meatballs were better than spaghetti, which was just like any other pasta dish.
Excelente!
Love this place food is Awesome and service Is impeccable!! This is a must in Miami if you love quality Italian
The espresso martini was amazing. $11 at 8 pm. Fabulous.
Simply the BEST! Bada Bing!

Staff excellent
Food superb
An experience of a lifetime
Save your money. The Diner serves better Italian food. All these recipes originally are Greek anyway. The food is not that good. I'm sure you can boil pasta and heat up sauce ğŸ˜‚â€¦

Everything was 5 Stars at Raoâ€™s!!!
Service, food, staff, you name it!!!
The meatballs are truly to die forâ€¦ the baked clams were delicious!!!
Drinks were amazing and free pourâ€¦ got me boozing after the second martini ğŸ˜…ğŸ˜…
The staff is what really makes this place one of the best restaurants out there!!

Raoâ€™s is the best Italian restaurant in these United States. My wife and good friends ate there and every single dish far exceeded our expectations. Tommy is the most welcoming and friendly guy youâ€™d want to meet. The atmosphere. The history. The food. Everything about this restaurant is PHENOMENAL. If you ever get the chance to go, do not miss out on any of it. Get the drinks, get all the appetizers, get as many entrees as you can eat and ENJOY! Fantastic team of cooks, waiters and owners - youâ€™ll see when you go.

I consider myself extremely lucky to be able to eat at the classic Italian restaurant. The experience itself is unlike any other restaurant I have ever been at. After having a few drinks at the bar we were lucky enough to get a seat whichâ€¦

Amazing!!! All the food we ordered was cooked to Perfection, Flavors! Ridiculous.. Get the Pork Chops they are Delicious!! The steak cooked just right... Meatballs were excellent and the Pesto pasta was fantastic!! As for the Seafood salad getting two orders for one order will not be enough... Amazing Staff, Tommy was the BEST, Fuuny as they come to entertain you as they serve you!!!

Ah, Rao's. The hard to get reservation. I am one of the fortunate, "average Joe's" to get a reservation at this iconic Manhattan restaurant. The drinks are made perfect, the food is very, very good. The hosts Ron and Joe treat you like family with a handshake when you walk through the front door. I will just  tell you what my party had for dinner last week. Apps: baked clams, roasted peppers, and the house salad. Next up: shells with ricotta and their famous meatballs all delicious. Now on to the main course: eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken parm, and shrimp fra diavolo. Dessert was delicious homemade cheesecake with chocolate ice cream and espresso. Rao's is always great. It is really a dining experience. You never know who you'll see there

A complete privelage to have been able to been able to dine in such a cuisine staple of NYC and the world. Pictures of famous people who dined at the same place as you.  Amazing food, meatballs were out of this world. Everything was phenomenal.

What an amazing place and an amazing experience. Itâ€™s not just the nostalgic and historical ambiance of its 100+ year history. The food was amazing and delicious. The wet meatballs compared to the dry. It was lush versus crispy softness.â€¦

Rao's is simply an experience and treat to enjoy.  The food was in fact wonderful from the meatballs , the spicy calamari,  the parm and the chocolate dessert.   The service was absolutely perfect and personable.  The servers treated us like we were regulars which really made the evening.  The buzz in the atmosphere seems to just be generated by the thrill everyone at the 10 tables has about being able to experience this NYC gem.  One tip, don't forget to bring cash !  Loved it and look forward to getting a chance to go again.
Rao's has a great bib with professional waiters. The apps are amazing, love the family style.

You need to be a New Yorker or have lived in this city to understand this place. It all starts with "who do you know" to get you a table and once in, it's all "different than usual". The "Al Capone" ambiance is still noticeable - it's cashâ€¦

What can you say about Raos? If you're lucky enough to get an invite here you will thoroughly enjoy your experience. Everything on the menu is fantastic and is good or better than "grandmas". Can't wait to go back. The experience was amazing!

Went there not sure if we were going to be able to sit down and eat as we all know itâ€™s almost impossible. Sat at the bar drinking Negronis for almost 2 hours, trying to talk my way into a table. Thank you Joe and to the staff for accommodating us. Food was as good as you imagine it would be. Awesome experience!
Perfect version of Italian American dishes served in a private club. Meatballs and seafood salad are a must. The staff is personable and will become your best friends by the end of the night.

If you have a problem with this place itâ€™s because youâ€™re the problem. Absolutely the best Italian food youâ€™ll ever have. Bring an extra $20 and throw it in the chute box, the staff loveâ€™s Christmas all year long. Love this place!!

One of the most hospitable dining experiences I've ever had.

The entire dining room was engaged with one another, friendly staff, great atmosphere with even better food.

If you ever have the opportunity to dine here, you won't be disappointed.

The spaghetti sauce is absolutely amazing and it reminds me so much of the homemade sauce that my mother and grandmother would make, so I just want to say that this sauce brings back some really great memories because it makes me think ofâ€¦

I want this pandemic is to be over and hate this situation but I have to say being able to get take out from Raoâ€™s is a blessing. You can go to their takeout website at raostogo.com and order, then pick up at a chosen time. We have done aâ€¦

I was really excited to visit this place for the first time since Iâ€™ve seen their sauce on the shelfâ€™s of Costco and Walmart. But be cautious of visiting this restaurant In person, they donâ€™t seem to mention needing a reservation on their website or on the Google listing but they refused to sit me and my Asian friend despite an abundance of tables. When I asked about making reservations for a future visit, I was told they can only be made in person with the manager and they open new reservations in November for a few years in advance. They seem very selective in which people are allowed to dine at this restaurant and many patrons may appreciate a more open and welcoming atmosphere.

East Harlemâ€™s @raosnyc founded in 1896 is one of the oldest family owned restaurants in the USA. Getting a table in this national treasure is only possible with â€œtable rightsâ€ or as a guest of one of the regulars here. I was lucky enough toâ€¦

Let me start off by saying you are coming here for the experience. Countless legends have eaten here over the years and if you have a chance to eat here I would jump at the opportunity because one like this does not come along very often. Being a part of the East Harlem Giglio Society, my friends and I have been here numerous times to drink at the bar which you can do but you cannot eat if you do not have a table. Getting a table is near to impossible and the only way to get one is if you  know someone.

I had the privilege of eating here the Friday before Christmas December 22nd 2017 and again this past Friday March 2nd 2018. Each time was great, food was fabulous and the environment is incredible. Being that our crew knows most of the workers here makes it even better as it feels like you are going to eat with family not at a restaurant. I must say it is not the same without Frankie Pellegrino (the original owner who passed away last year) but the love is still there as well as Nicky the Vest. There are no menus, so when you place your order they tell you what are the options for the night. We sampled almost everything and all dishes were delicious.

There are no checks either, whoever pays the bill gets whisked away to the back to settle up at the end of the night. You can expect to spend a good $150-$200 per person which is pretty reasonable for the hardest place to eat in NYC. We usually stay until close and by that time you will run into see someone that is considered important. It all depends on your definition of important or famous.

Great place go once a year and the treat you like family seafood salad baked clams broccoli rabbe orchetta is best Raos sauce and linguini great and steak with peas and prosciutto great and best black Raspberry ice cream
Definitely that one restaurant you write home about. The food and the ambiance was like no other. If you can get a table make it happen at all cost .

I've always wanted the opportunity to eat at the original RAO's and today I had the opportunity for the next best thing, RAO's to go.

Everything was absolutely delicious. We enjoyed Meatballs, Penne Alla Vodka, Eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken Parmigiana, Veal Marsala, Lemon Chicken, Peas with Prosciutto & Onions, and Broccoli Rabe. I must say the Veal Marsala was next level. I hope when things do get back to normal RAO's continues to offer to go as I would love to experience this again!
Always amazing. And tonight was no exception. The baked clams, roasted red peppers, and the pasta with sausage and broccoli rabe were particularly exceptional
Great night out food  was unbelievable & love the meatballs & fish salad
